Title: Training data bias in demographic representation
Description: Underrepresentation of certain demographic groups in training dataset may lead to disparate model performance across populations
Stakeholders: Data Science Team, Legal, Ethics Board
Success_Criteria: Demographic performance parity within 5% across all groups
Rationale: Initial bias audit revealed 15% performance gap for underrepresented groups; mitigation through targeted data augmentation in progress

Title: Model drift in production environment
Description: Gradual degradation of model accuracy due to changing input distributions over time
Success_Criteria: Drift detection alerts within 24 hours of threshold breach
Rationale: Drift monitoring implemented with automated alerting; monthly manual review added as secondary control
Approver_Notes: Accepted with condition of quarterly review cadence

Title: Insufficient explainability for regulated decisions
Description: Model outputs used in consequential decisions lack adequate explanation for affected individuals
Success_Criteria: Explanation provided for 100% of adverse decisions meeting regulatory threshold
Rationale: High-risk use case under EU AI Act requires transparency measures; evaluating SHAP vs LIME approaches

Title: Selection of privacy-preserving technique for federated deployment
Description: Decision between differential privacy, federated learning, and secure multi-party computation for sensitive data processing
Rationale: Differential privacy selected: balances privacy guarantees with model utility; federated learning rejected due to infrastructure complexity; secure MPC rejected due to latency requirements
Approver_Notes: Approved with annual review of privacy budget parameters

Title: Model architecture selection for classification task
Description: Choice between transformer-based model with higher accuracy vs interpretable ensemble with clearer decision paths
Rationale: Interpretable ensemble selected despite 3% accuracy reduction; regulatory context requires explainability for affected individuals; transformer option documented for potential future reassessment
Approver_Notes: Conditionally approved; reassess if accuracy requirements change

Title: Missing documentation for training data preprocessing steps
Description: Internal audit identified incomplete documentation of data transformations applied during model training
Success_Criteria: Complete preprocessing documentation with versioned pipeline configs
Rationale: Audit finding severity: Medium; root cause traced to lack of documentation requirements in data pipeline templates; corrective action includes template updates and retroactive documentation

Title: Document all preprocessing transformations for AIS-2024-001
Description: Create comprehensive documentation of all data transformations including normalization, encoding, and feature engineering steps
Success_Criteria: Documentation covers 100% of preprocessing steps with input/output specifications
Rationale: Child action of FIND-001; prioritized due to upcoming external audit

Title: Update data pipeline templates with documentation requirements
Description: Modify standard templates to include mandatory documentation fields for all transformation steps
Success_Criteria: Templates enforce documentation for new pipelines; validation in CI/CD
Rationale: Preventive measure to avoid recurrence; will apply to all future pipelines

Title: AI Ethics and Responsible AI Training
Description: Required training for all team members working on AI systems covering bias, fairness, transparency, and accountability
Rationale: Annual required training; completion tracked in HR system; refresher required annually
Approver_Notes: All assigned personnel completed; 3 new hires to complete within 30 days of start

Title: Q1 2024 Management Review - AI Systems
Description: Quarterly leadership review of AI system performance, risk posture, and resource allocation
Rationale: Covered: 2 production AI systems; 5 risks reviewed; 2 escalated for additional resources; approved continued operation with enhanced monitoring
Approver_Notes: Next review: Q2 2024; action items assigned to risk owners

Title: False positive rate spike in production
Description: Automated monitoring detected 40% increase in false positive rate over 72-hour period
Success_Criteria: False positive rate returned to baseline (< 5% variance)
Rationale: Root cause: upstream data schema change not communicated; resolution: rollback to v2.2.9 then coordinated update; preventive: added schema validation in pipeline
Approver_Notes: Incident closed; schema validation prevents recurrence; no customer impact due to rapid detection
